math_problem.A1895: Determine all the functions \( f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R} \) such that \( f\left(x^{2}+f(y)\right)=f(f(x))+f\left(y^{2}\right)+2f(xy) \) for all real number \( x \) and \( y \).

A1895: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Algebra -> Equations and Inequalities
Mathematics -> Algebra -> Intermediate Algebra -> Quadratic Functions

ground_truth: f(x)=0 \text{ for all } x \text{ and } f(x)=x^{2} \text{ for all } x
